{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amphotericin B, Vancomycin, and Gentamicin are all drugs that are excreted by the kidneys, so their doses need to be reduced in patients with renal failure to prevent toxicity. On the other hand, Doxycycline is primarily metabolized in the liver and excreted in the feces, so it does not require dose adjustment in patients with renal failure.", "answer_choice": "D. Doxycycline"}
